issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A fix has been committed, and will be part of the next release
status.name: Release Pending

fields.description: I've seen in a QA set up that Imaging service stack creation was not progressing. The ASG was not created at all probably due to temporary unavailable auto-scaling service. The stack was in create in progress state and did not progress for 12+ hours. This is bad situation since esi-tools can't resolve this problem and it requires several manual steps to fix.
fields.summary: Service stack creation can get stuck

comments.body: [~vasya], please add the stack event information to this issue.
[~sjones], I've recycled the system :( but the over system in QA in the similar shape.

Stack events after 30+ minutes from create stack request
{code}
[root@b-41 ~]# euform-describe-stack-events euca-internal-imaging-service
EVENT	euca-internal-imaging-service	Role-CREATE_COMPLETE-1443640715057	AWS::IAM::Role	Role	euca-internal-imaging-service-Role-JTLJAG6ZI7O1Y	2015-09-30T19:18:35.057Z	CREATE_COMPLETE	
EVENT	euca-internal-imaging-service	SecurityGroup-CREATE_IN_PROGRESS-1443640714366	AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup	SecurityGroupeuca-internal-imaging-service-SecurityGroup-5QSZSRTBLFWXA	2015-09-30T19:18:34.366Z	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS	
EVENT	euca-internal-imaging-service	Role-CREATE_IN_PROGRESS-1443640713774	AWS::IAM::Role	Role	euca-internal-imaging-service-Role-JTLJAG6ZI7O1Y	2015-09-30T19:18:33.774Z	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS	
EVENT	euca-internal-imaging-service	SecurityGroup-CREATE_IN_PROGRESS-1443640713071	AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup	SecurityGroup2015-09-30T19:18:33.071Z	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS	
EVENT	euca-internal-imaging-service	Role-CREATE_IN_PROGRESS-1443640712946	AWS::IAM::Role	Role		2015-09-30T19:18:32.946Z	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS	
EVENT	euca-internal-imaging-service	7e83cba5-d648-4f7a-8451-557e738fc3db	AWS::CloudFormation::Stack	euca-internal-imaging-service	arn:aws:cloudformation::000299242889:stack/euca-internal-imaging-service/c80a2120-e734-4be2-9ed0-042c8fc708ea2015-09-30T19:18:30.975Z	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS	User Initiated
{code}
[~vasya] How exactly did you get into this state? Was this just a standard fast start installation?

[~mmunn1], I've seen this on two QA set ups. QA set up the system and calls esi-manage-stack -a create imaging. I was not able to  put system in that state after it was started. I guess it is somehow related to some components starting up. I'd try to disable autoscaling, kicking stack creation and enabling it back.
[~vasya] Yes the cloud formation stack creation just seems to stop after the security group creation?  The InstanceProfile, LaunchConfiguration and ASG resources creation never even gets started?
[~mmunn1], I don't know. I only see statuses reported by the system. There are no errors in the logs as far as I can tell.

I have reproduced this in another environment as well. It seems to be stuck in progress
{code}
 [g-12-12:/var/log/eucalyptus]euform-describe-stacks euca-internal-imaging-service
STACK	euca-internal-imaging-service	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS	User Initiated	Imaging worker stack	2015-10-01T18:04:58.050Z
PARAMETER	CERTARN		****

PARAMETER	InitScript

PARAMETER	KeyName

PARAMETER	EuareServiceUrl		euare.localhost
PARAMETER	ComputeServiceUrl		compute.localhost
PARAMETER	VmExpirationDays		180
PARAMETER	AvailabilityZones		one
PARAMETER	NumberOfWorkers		1
[g-12-12:/var/log/eucalyptus]euform-list-stack-resources euca-internal-imaging-service
RESOURCE	SecurityGroup	euca-internal-imaging-service-SecurityGroup-SH9OF05L3EWLD	AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup	2015-10-01T18:05:03.661Z	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS	
RESOURCE	Role	euca-internal-imaging-service-Role-EAH4RWFLGP5WB	AWS::IAM::Role	2015-10-01T18:05:04.738Z	CREATE_COMPLETE	
RESOURCE	InstanceProfile		AWS::IAM::InstanceProfile	2015-10-01T18:05:06.459Z	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS	
[g-12-12:/var/log/eucalyptus]euform-describe-stack-events euca-internal-imaging-service
EVENT	euca-internal-imaging-service	InstanceProfile-CREATE_IN_PROGRESS-1443722706441	AWS::IAM::InstanceProfile	InstanceProfile		2015-10-01T18:05:06.441Z	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS	
EVENT	euca-internal-imaging-service	Role-CREATE_COMPLETE-1443722704744	AWS::IAM::Role	Role	euca-internal-imaging-service-Role-EAH4RWFLGP5WB	2015-10-01T18:05:04.744Z	CREATE_COMPLETE	
EVENT	euca-internal-imaging-service	SecurityGroup-CREATE_IN_PROGRESS-1443722703677	AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup	SecurityGroup	euca-internal-imaging-service-SecurityGroup-SH9OF05L3EWLD	2015-10-01T18:05:03.677Z	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS	
EVENT	euca-internal-imaging-service	Role-CREATE_IN_PROGRESS-1443722702711	AWS::IAM::Role	Role	euca-internal-imaging-service-Role-EAH4RWFLGP5WB	2015-10-01T18:05:02.711Z	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS	
EVENT	euca-internal-imaging-service	SecurityGroup-CREATE_IN_PROGRESS-1443722702031	AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup	SecurityGroup		2015-10-01T18:05:02.031Z	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS	
EVENT	euca-internal-imaging-service	Role-CREATE_IN_PROGRESS-1443722701762	AWS::IAM::Role	Role		2015-10-01T18:05:01.762Z	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS	
EVENT	euca-internal-imaging-service	d91cfe8d-dd2b-452b-b00b-ea8115861859	AWS::CloudFormation::Stack	euca-internal-imaging-service	arn:aws:cloudformation::000824914768:stack/euca-internal-imaging-service/e62f018c-96c7-4acb-89ec-c4bfa8f2b336	2015-10-01T18:04:59.621Z	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS	User Initiated
{code}
[g-12-12:/var/log/eucalyptus]

[~sjones] It seems that CF gets stuck at various places in the euca-internal-imaging-service stack. It can be reproduced fairly consistently. There are no helpful errors and it appears to be an issue in SWF.  I have a system stuck in the following state:
{code}
c-29:~]euform-describe-stack-events euca-internal-imaging-service
EVENT	euca-internal-imaging-service	Role-CREATE_IN_PROGRESS-1443728043873	AWS::IAM::Role	Role		2015-10-01T19:34:03.873Z	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS	
EVENT	euca-internal-imaging-service	f5c93505-1a31-4a17-891c-38b5661f45c0	AWS::CloudFormation::Stack	euca-internal-imaging-service	arn:aws:cloudformation::000602886722:stack/euca-internal-imaging-service/c4421a67-c7ac-4237-9004-d02a3b6ab681	2015-10-01T19:34:01.459Z	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS	User Initiated
{code}
Any pointers on how to better diagnose this issue would be greatly appreciated.

[~mmunn1], the troubleshooting steps outlined in this document are a good start:

https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/STS/CloudFormation+Service+4.3
[~mmunn1] It might be good to run any stack (not just one created via the esi-manage-stack command) to see if it gets stuck when the LOG stuff happens.

This issue only appears to happen when using boto as in is done with esi-manage-stack to connect to cloudformation. I do not see this issue using euca2ools. I am investigating why this happens in boto only?

This issue only manifests itself when you use boto to create a stack and immediately change the  "coud.euca_log_level"  from or to DEBUG or greater.  I could not reproduce this using euca2ools to create the stack at all. You do not see this issue changing the log level to or from INFO or less. With DEBUG or greater the log level change itself generates a lot of log entries as well as the expected increase in verbosity. This appears to be a timing issue with SWF.

[~ethomas] this appears to stop at line #97 in CreateStackWorkflowImpl:
 waitFor(promiseFor(activities.finalizeCreateStack(stackId, accountId, effectiveUserId)))  ?
[~sjones] Thanks Steve! That does resolve the issue in my testing.
[~vasya] - can you please provide the steps for reproducing/verifying this issue?
[~swathi], this particular issue was triggered by basic QA set up process. I don't know now to trigger it :(
[~swathi] Did this ever get verified?
[~mmunn1] - nope, this must have slipped through my list. I can verify it if the shared system is still up, let me check on that
[~tony] This seems to have slipped through the cracks.
Has not been reported in the releases since this was fixed. Closing it out now.
